<xen:title>{xen:phrase bdmedal_medal_award}{xen:if '{$medal.medal_id}', ': {$medal.name}'}</xen:title> <xen:h1>{xen:phrase bdmedal_medal_award}</xen:h1>
<xen:if is="{$medal.medal_id}"> <xen:navigation> <xen:breadcrumb href="{xen:adminlink 'medal-medals/edit', $medal}">{$medal.name}</xen:breadcrumb> </xen:navigation> </xen:if>
<xen:form action="{xen:adminlink 'medal-medals/award'}" class="AutoValidator" data-redirect="yes">
<xen:textboxunit label="{xen:phrase user_name}:" name="target" value="{$target}" inputclass="AutoComplete"/>
<xen:selectunit label="{xen:phrase bdmedal_medal}:" name="medal_id" value="{$medalId}"> <xen:option value=""> </xen:option> <xen:options source="$allMedal" /> </xen:selectunit>
<xen:textboxunit label="{xen:phrase bdmedal_award_reason}:" name="reason" value="{$reason}" rows="5" hint="{xen:phrase you_may_use_html}" />
<xen:checkboxunit label="" explain="{xen:phrase bdmedal_avoid_duplicated_explain}"> <xen:option name="avoid_duplicated" value="1" selected="{xen:helper bdMedal_getOption, defaultAvoidDuplicated}">{xen:phrase bdmedal_avoid_duplicated}</xen:option> </xen:checkboxunit>
<xen:submitunit save="{xen:phrase bdmedal_medal_award}"> </xen:submitunit>
<input type="hidden" name="_xfConfirm" value="1" /> </xen:form>

{xen:phrase bdmedal_awarded_users}: {$medal.name} {xen:phrase bdmedal_awarded_users} {$medal.name} + {xen:phrase bdmedal_medal_award}

    {xen:phrase bdmedal_awarded_medals} {xen:phrase bdmedal_reverse_award}

{$medal.name}

<xen:title>{xen:phrase bdmedal_edit_award}: {$medal.name}</xen:title> <xen:h1>{xen:phrase bdmedal_edit_award}</xen:h1>
<xen:navigation> <xen:breadcrumb href="{xen:adminlink 'medal-medals/edit', $medal}">{$medal.name}</xen:breadcrumb> <xen:breadcrumb href="{xen:adminlink 'medal-medals/awarded-users', $medal}">{xen:phrase bdmedal_awarded_users}</xen:breadcrumb> </xen:navigation>
<xen:form action="{xen:adminlink 'medal-medals/edit-award', $medal}" class="formOverlay">
<xen:textboxunit label="{xen:phrase bdmedal_award_reason}:" name="award_reason" value="{$awarded.award_reason}" />
<xen:submitunit save="{xen:phrase save}" />
<input type="hidden" name="awarded_id" value="{$awarded.awarded_id}" /> <input type="hidden" name="_xfConfirm" value="1" /> </xen:form>
<xen:edithint template="bdmedal_medal_edit" />

phrases.phrase: Enable this option to avoid awarding a medal to an user more than once. Any users who have been awarded the medal before will be silently ignored. You can control the default state of this option by editing the "Default to Avoid Duplicated" option in [bd] Medal option page.
The requested Category could not be found
No clues of Category at this moment...
Please confirm that you want to delete the following Category
This page shows a list of the medals that you can be awarded by doing good to the community.
If you want to use a special fine-tuned image for this size, upload your file here. Otherwise you can leave it blank to have the system automatically generate it.
Medal must belong to a category.
The requested Medal could not be found
This medal has not been awarded to anybody yet.
No clues of Medal at this moment...
Please confirm that you want to delete the following Medal
No medals have been created yet.
No users have been found to award.
Please confirm that you want to reverse award
Bottom of the User Info Extra section (containing register date, message count, etc.)
Top of the User Info Extra section (containing register date, message count, etc.)
Bottom of the User Info Text section (containing username, user title)
Top of the User Info Text section (containing username, user title)
The requested award record could not be found.
This user has not been awarded any medals yet.
{name} has not been awarded any medals yet.
{name} have been awarded with the medal {medal}.
{name} have been awarded with the medal {medal} already.
You have been awarded a medal: {medal}
If this option is set (larger than 0), the list of awarded users in the Help page will be limit to a maximum of this value.
Enable this option to turn on "Avoid Duplicated" option in manual medal award form in AdminCP.

Normally, medal image will be store in 2 sizes: original size (code name "L") and tiny size (code name "T"). If you wish to use additional image size, you can specify the maximum width / height here. An image will be prepared with the code name "M" for all medals from now on (you will have to re-upload image for old medals). Leave it zero to disable this feature.

Normally, medal image will be store in 2 sizes: original size (code name "L") and tiny size (code name "T"). If you wish to use additional image size, you can specify the maximum width / height here. An image will be prepared with the code name "S" for all medals from now on (you will have to re-upload image for old medals). Leave it zero to disable this feature.
Select the order mode for medals listing in posts. You will need to rebuild medal information (AdminCP > Tools > Rebuild Caches) in order to update existing medal display.
You can choose to have the medals list page a sub-page in the Help page or let it have a dedicated navigation tab.

[bd] Medal System: Select the position you want the medals to show up. If you want to display the medal elsewhere, please select the manual option and edit the template yourself, simply adding <xen:include template="bdmedal_message_medals" /> to your "message_user_info" template. You may also use <xen:include template="bdmedal_post_medals" /> in "post" template.
View awarded users in medals list

The size of the medal images. By default, there is only 2 sizes available: L (original) and T (tiny, 12px). You can render medium and small images by configure the options. Be sure to double check here if medals do not show up in messages.
You can limit the maximum number of medals to display in messages here. If this property is set, only the latest X medals will show up.
Show the awarded date in tooltip for each medal.
The size of the medal images in profile page block.
The size of the medal images in Medals profile page tab.
The size of the medal images in sidebar visitor panel.

property.title: Image Size
property.description: The size of the medal images. By default, there is only 2 sizes available: L (original) and T (tiny, 12px). You can render medium and small images by configure the options. Be sure to double check here if medals do not show up in messages.

property.title: Max Medals
property.description: You can limit the maximum number of medals to display in messages here. If this property is set, only the latest X medals will show up.

property.title: Image Size
property.description: The size of the medal images in profile page block.

property.title: Image Size
property.description: The size of the medal images in Medals profile page tab.

property.title: Show Date
property.description: Show the awarded date in tooltip for each medal.

property.title: Image Size
property.description: The size of the medal images in sidebar visitor panel.

<xen:title>{xen:phrase bdmedal_award_medal}: {$user.username}</xen:title> <xen:h1>{xen:phrase bdmedal_award_medal}</xen:h1> <xen:navigation> <xen:breadcrumb href="{xen:link full:members, $user}">{$user.username}</xen:breadcrumb> </xen:navigation>
<form action="{xen:link 'members/award-medal', $user}" method="post" class="xenForm formOverlay AutoValidator" data-redirect="yes">
<dl class="ctrlUnit"> <dt><label for="ctrl_medal_id">{xen:phrase bdmedal_medal}:</label></dt> <dd> <select id="ctrl_medal_id" name="medal_id" class="textCtrl"> <xen:foreach loop="$medalsGrouped" key="$categoryName" value="$categoryMedals"> <optgroup label="{$categoryName}"> <xen:foreach loop="$categoryMedals" value="$medal"> <option value="{$medal.value}"{xen:if '{$medal.disabled}', ' disabled="disabled"'}>{$medal.label}</option> </xen:foreach> </optgroup> </xen:foreach> </select> </dd> </dl>
<dl class="ctrlUnit"> <dt><label for="ctrl_reason">{xen:phrase bdmedal_award_reason}:</label></dt> <dd> <textarea id="ctrl_reason" name="reason" class="textCtrl Elastic"></textarea> </dd> </dl>
<dl class="ctrlUnit submitUnit"> <dt></dt> <dd> <input type="submit" value="{xen:phrase save}" class="button primary" /> </dd> </dl>
<input type="hidden" name="_xfToken" value="{$visitor.csrf_token_page}" /> <input type="hidden" name="_xfConfirm" value="1" /> </form>
